t: Zoox (company) - Wikipedia
s: 4 days ago - Zoox, Inc. is an American technology company subsidiary of Amazon developing driverless vehicles that provide mobility as a service. It is headquartered in Foster City, California, and has offices of operations in the San Francisco Bay Area and Seattle, Washington.

t: Zoox: It's Not a Car | Zoox
s: Zoox is a purpose-built autonomous vehicle designed for riders, not drivers. Learn more about the Zoox robotaxi and the future of ride-hailing.

t: Why Amazon’s Zoox is taking a different approach to autonomous taxis
s: October 11, 2024 - On Thursday, Tesla finally unveiled a prototype for its Cybercab robotaxi. But Amazon-owned Zoox has its own ideas about how to build the autonomous taxi fleet of the future.

t: We’re acquiring Zoox to help bring their vision of autonomous ride-hailing to reality
s: June 26, 2020 - Amazon has signed an agreement to acquire Zoox, a California-based company working to design autonomous ride-hailing vehicles from the ground up. Aicha Evans, Zoox CEO, and Jesse Levinson, Zoox co-founder and CTO, will continue to lead the team as they innovate and drive towards their mission.

s: June 26, 2020 - Amazon is jumping deeper into the market for autonomous driving with the purchase of Zoox, which was valued at over $3 billion in 2018.

t: How Zoox vehicles “find themselves” in an ever-changing world - Amazon Science
s: November 10, 2022 - The Zoox purpose-built robot is an autonomous, pod-like electric vehicle that can carry four passengers in comfort. It has no forward or backward, being equally happy to drive in either direction, at up to 75 miles per hour, and can move all four wheels independently.
